segments.text: I notice the woman is so focused on that plate, like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge, and she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s going to regret ignoring that puddle later.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far to reach those cookies, it’s almost funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But that stool looks like it’s about to collapse under him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her treat, like it’s the most normal thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how bright and peaceful the garden looks outside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s such a contrast to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever notice the water or the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just asking for trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like yelling at them to be careful.
segments.speaker: PAR
